alert.note: Alert for Holmes; Wayne (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 10:53AM EST until February 20 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Cuyahoga River At Independence affecting Cuyahoga County. Cuyahoga River At Old Portage affecting Summit County. Mahoning River At Warren affecting Trumbull County. Mahoning River At Leavittsburg affecting Trumbull County. Mahoning River At Youngstown affecting Mahoning and Trumbull Counties. Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station affecting Trumbull County. Killbuck Creek Near Killbuck affecting Holmes and Wayne Counties. For the Cuyahoga River...including Old Portage, Independence...Major flooding is forecast. For the Killbuck Creek...including Killbuck...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Mahoning River...including Leavittsburg, Warren, Youngstown...Major flooding is forecast. For the Site Specific Non-forecast Pt...including Phalanx Station... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Killbuck Creek Near Killbuck. * WHEN...From this evening to late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Private property on Water Street in the Village of Killbuck flooded. Several county and local roads impassable including State Route 60 south and County Road 621. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Thursday the stage was 13.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 16.8 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.8 feet on 02/24/1975. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 900 PM EST.
